intro: Bonatea sudanensis, commonly known as the Sudanese bonatea, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Sudan. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its robust, clustered growth habit. The plant features a slender trunk and large, pinnately compound leaves that are adapted to withstand high temperatures and limited water availability. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically appearing at the base of the leaves. Bonatea sudanensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various desert animals.
